title: How to Convert .GPX to GP5 (with Tuxguitar)

steps.title: Install Java.
steps.content: Install Java. You'll need Java installed on your computer in order to run the program that will convert your GPX files. You can download for Java from the Java website . Once you've downloaded the installer, follow the prompts to install Java .

steps.title: Visit the TuxGuitar download site.
steps.content: Visit the TuxGuitar download site . This free, open-source program can read and convert all GuitarPro file formats. It is available for Windows, Mac, and Linux.

steps.title: Click the Download button.
steps.content: Click the Download button. This begins downloading the correct installer for your operating system.

steps.title: Double-click the downloaded installer.
steps.content: Double-click the downloaded installer. You'll find this in your Downloads folder once it finishes downloading.

steps.title: Click Run if prompted by Windows.
steps.content: Click Run if prompted by Windows. Windows may warn you about starting an unknown program.

steps.title: Click Next when prompted.
steps.content: Click Next when prompted.

steps.title: Click I accept the agreement and then click Next.
steps.content: Click I accept the agreement and then click Next .

steps.title: Click Next to accept the default installation location.
steps.content: Click Next to accept the default installation location. You can change this if you'd like, but most users won't need to.

steps.title: Click Next to start installation.
steps.content: Click Next to start installation.

steps.title: Click Finish after installation is complete.
steps.content: Click Finish after installation is complete.

steps.title: Double-click the TuxGuitar shortcut on your desktop.
steps.content: Double-click the TuxGuitar shortcut on your desktop. You're now ready to convert your GPX files to GP5 format.

steps.title: Visit the TuxGuitar download site.
steps.content: Visit the TuxGuitar download site . TuxGuitar is a free, open-source program that you can use to convert your GuitarPro tab files.

steps.title: Open Finder.
steps.content: Open Finder. You can find the Finder icon in your Dock.

steps.title: Click the Downloads folder.
steps.content: Click the Downloads folder. You'll see it listed in the menu on the left side of the Finder window.

steps.title: Double-click the tuxguitar-1.X-macosx-cocoa-64.app file.
steps.content: Double-click the tuxguitar-1. X -macosx-cocoa-64.app file. You'll see the tuxguitar Application file appear in the Downloads folder.

steps.title: Drag the tuxguitar Application file to the Applications folder.
steps.content: Drag the tuxguitar Application file to the Applications folder.

steps.title: Open the Applications folder.
steps.content: Open the Applications folder.

steps.title: Right-click the tuxguitar program and select Open.
steps.content: Right-click the tuxguitar program and select Open. If you double-click it, you'll be warned that you can't start the program because it was downloaded online.

steps.title: Click Open in the window that appears.
steps.content: Click Open in the window that appears. Now that TuxGuitar is open, you can start converting your files.

steps.title: Click the File menu in TuxGuitar.
steps.content: Click the File menu in TuxGuitar.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open .

steps.title: Browse for the GPX file you want to convert.
steps.content: Browse for the GPX file you want to convert.

steps.title: Select the file and click Open.
steps.content: Select the file and click Open . It may take a few moments for the file to load in TuxGuitar.

steps.title: Click the File menu again.
steps.content: Click the File menu again.

steps.title: Click Save As.
steps.content: Click Save As .

steps.title: Click the All Supported Formats menu.
steps.content: Click the All Supported Formats menu.

steps.title: Click Guitar Pro 5.
steps.content: Click Guitar Pro 5 . This will tell TuxGuitar to save the file in the GP5 format. You can also select from earlier versions, such as Guitar Pro 3.

steps.title: Choose where to save the converted file.
steps.content: Choose where to save the converted file. By default, it will save to the same location as the original.

steps.title: Click the Save button.
steps.content: Click the Save button. A new copy of the GPX file will be created at the location you specified with the GP5 extension instead. The original file will not be modified.
